Activity: Arrive at work, log in to the system, and check emails. Mentally prepare for the week's tasks. Browse tech news sites (e.g., Hacker News, Reddit's r/programming) for interesting articles on software testing or data quality assurance.
Review the week's goals: verifying data elements, addressing missing data, and cross-validating against source documents. Break down the tasks into smaller, manageable steps.
Draft an email to @da-1 and @da-2 to understand the current data structure for influenza cases. Specifically, request the data dictionary and sample data schemas.
Begin creating a checklist of required data elements based on project documentation and initial understanding. Focus on patient demographics first (name, age, gender, address).
Research common data quality issues in EHR systems, particularly related to data completeness and accuracy. Look for relevant testing methodologies.
Lunch break. Read articles related to EHR data management and relevant QA methodologies.
Analyze the data dictionary and sample data schemas received from @da-1 and @da-2. Map the required data elements checklist to the actual data fields in the EHR system.
Develop a basic SQL query to extract patient demographic data for a sample of influenza cases. Focus on identifying null or missing values for required fields.
Analyze the results of the SQL query. Document the frequency of missing values for each demographic field.  Create a preliminary report outlining the data quality issues discovered.
Send an email to @itpm-1 and @clinlead-1 summarizing the initial data quality findings and propose a meeting to discuss data validation strategies. Prepare the presentation material for the meeting.
Prepare the plan for tomorrow's activity, focusing on vaccination and diagnose code data elements.
